sen.j: 雁金準一（かりがね じゅんいち、1879年（明治12年）7月30日 - 1959年（昭和34年）2月21日）は、明治から昭和にかけての棋士 (囲碁)。
sen.e: Junichi KARIGANE (July 30, 1879 - February 21, 1959) was a kishi (professional go player) from the Meiji period to the Showa period.
Junichi KARIGANE (July 30, 1879 - February 21, 1959) was a kishi (professional Go player) from the Meiji period to the Showa period.
Junichi KARIGANE (July 30, 1879 - February 21, 1959) was a kishi (professional Go player) from the Meiji period to the Showa period.

sen.j: 元の姓は岩瀬。
sen.e: His original family name was Iwase.
His original family name was Iwase.
His original family name was Iwase.

sen.j: 東京都出身、初代中川亀三郎門下、九段。
sen.e: He was from Tokyo Metropolis, a disciple of Kamezaburo Nagagawa (the first) and a 9 dan holder.
He was from Tokyo Metropolis, a disciple of Kamezaburo NAKAGAWA (the first) and a nine dan holder.
He was from Tokyo Metropolis, a disciple of Kamezaburo NAKAGAWA (the first) and a nine dan holder.

sen.j: 方円社、本因坊秀栄門下、日本棋院を経て、棋正社の総帥としての日本棋院との院社対抗戦などで、本因坊秀哉とライバル関係にあった。
sen.e: Experiencing Hoen-sha (Hoen Go Association,), a disciple of Shuei HONINBO and Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Association), KARIGANE, as a leader of Kisei-sha (Kisei Go Association) in In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Hoen-sha) matches, was in a competitive relation with Shusai HONINBO.

After the period of these Hoen-sha (Hoen Go Association), a disciple of Shuei HONINBO and Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Association), KARIGANE, as a leader of Kisei-sha (Kisei Go Association) in In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Hoen-sha) matches, was a rival of Shusai HONINBO.
sen.cmt: 無駄なカンマを削除しました。Experiencing→After the period of these,in a competitive relation with→a rival of と修正しました。
sen.e: After the period of these Hoen-sha (Hoen Go Association), a disciple of Shuei HONINBO and Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Association), KARIGANE, as a leader of Kisei-sha (Kisei Go Association) in In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Hoen-sha) matches, was a rival of Shusai HONINBO.

sen.j: 後に瓊韻社を創設。
sen.e: In later years he founded Keiin-sha.
Later he founded Keiin-sha.
sen.cmt: In later years→Later と修正しました。
sen.e: Later he founded Keiin-sha.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 生い立ち
sen.e: Backgrounds
Background
Background

sen.j: 東京都本郷 (文京区)に、元は三河国三河吉田藩の藩邸に仕える武家であった家に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Hongo (Bunkyo Ward), Tokyo Metropolis in a former samurai family serving in a Mikawa-Yoshida domain mansion of Mikawa Province.
He was born in Hongo (Bunkyo Ward), Tokyo Metropolis, in a former samurai family serving in the residence of Mikawa-Yoshida Domain of Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。a Mikawa-Yoshida domain mansion→the residence of Mikawa-Yoshida Domain と修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in Hongo (Bunkyo Ward), Tokyo Metropolis, in a former samurai family serving in the residence of Mikawa-Yoshida Domain of Mikawa Province.

sen.j: 4歳頃に碁好きの父より碁を学び、来客との対局などで大いに腕を上げ、学業のために父からは碁を禁じられるが秘かに「本因坊丈和著作」などで研鑽して遂に父から許しを得、12、3歳頃には近隣では敵無しとなる。
sen.e: He learned go at about the age of four from his father who liked go, improved his skills by playing go with visitors; however, in spite of the order from his father not to play go for the sake of his studies, he secretly brushed up his skills by learning from "Honinbo Jowa Chosaku" and so on, and at about the age of 12 to 13 after getting his father's permission at last, he had no rivals in his neighborhood.

He learned Go at about the age of 4 from his father who liked Go, improved his skills by playing Go with visitors; he secretly brushed up his skills by learning from 'Honinbo Jowa Chosaku' and so on in spite of the order from his father not to play Go for the sake of his studies, and at about the age of 12 to 13 after receiving his father's permission at last, he had no rivals in his neighborhood.
sen.cmt: go→Go,four→4,クォーツを修正しました。getting→receiving と修正しました。however を削除し、オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: He learned Go at about the age of 4 from his father who liked Go, improved his skills by playing Go with visitors; he secretly brushed up his skills by learning from 'Honinbo Jowa Chosaku' and so on in spite of the order from his father not to play Go for the sake of his studies, and at about the age of 12 to 13 after receiving his father's permission at last, he had no rivals in his neighborhood.

sen.j: 父の喘息のために困窮していたが、河北耕之助の知人の小野述信の援助を受け、1893年(明治26年)から方円社に通い始めるようになり、翌年入段する。
sen.e: Being in poverty because of his father's asthma, he got a support from Nobune ONO, an acquaintance, began to go to Hoen-sha and reached a professional rank of 1 dan the next year..
Being in poverty due to his father's asthma, he was supported by Nobune ONO, an acquaintance of Konosuke KAWAKITA, began to go to Hoen-sha in 1893 and became a ranked player the following year.
sen.cmt: because of→due to,got a support from→was supported by,next→following と修正しました。「河北耕之助の」を補いました。「1893年から」を補いました。”入段＝有段者になること”として修正しました。ピリオドを修正しました。
sen.e: Being in poverty due to his father's asthma, he was supported by Nobune ONO, an acquaintance of Konosuke KAWAKITA, began to go to Hoen-sha in 1893 and became a ranked player the following year.

sen.j: その後伊藤博文の恩顧を受けて伊藤宅に居し、また広島市、下関市に随伴し、「碁打小僧」として知られるようになる。
sen.e: Subsequently favored by Hirobumi ITO, he lived in his house, and while accompanying him to Hiroshima City or Shimonoseki City, he came to be known as a "Go Kid".
Subsequently favored by Hirobumi ITO, he lived in Ito's house, and while accompanying him to Hiroshima City and Shimonoseki City, he came to be known as a 'Go Kid.'
sen.cmt: his→Ito's,or→and と修正しました。クォーツ、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Subsequently favored by Hirobumi ITO, he lived in Ito's house, and while accompanying him to Hiroshima City and Shimonoseki City, he came to be known as a 'Go Kid.'

sen.j: 3年後、自ら生計を立てるべく本郷に稽古場を開く。
sen.e: Three years later, he opened a training room in Hongo to make a living for himself.
Three years later, he opened a training room in Hongo to make a living for himself.
Three years later, he opened a training room in Hongo to make a living for himself.

sen.j: 1896年に方円社に入塾、中川亀三郎退隠とともにその内弟子となり、各地遊歴にも随行する。
sen.e: After entering Hoen-sha in 1896, he became a private pupil of the retired Kamezaburo NAKAGAWA and accompanied him on his errantries to various places.
After entering Hoen-sha in 1896, he became a private pupil of the retired Kamezaburo NAKAGAWA, and accompanied him on his trips to various places.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。 errantries→trips と修正しました。
sen.e: After entering Hoen-sha in 1896, he became a private pupil of the retired Kamezaburo NAKAGAWA, and accompanied him on his trips to various places.

sen.j: 1898年(明治31年)二段。
sen.e: He took 2 dan in 1898.
He became two dan in 1898.
He became two dan in 1898.

sen.j: 同年から19世本因坊秀栄の研究会「四象会」に参加。
sen.e: In the same year he joined Shisho-kai, a study group of Honinbo Shuei (the 19th).
In the same year he joined 'Shisho-kai,' a study group of Honinbo Shuei (the 19th).
sen.cmt: クォーツを補いました。
sen.e: In the same year he joined 'Shisho-kai,' a study group of Honinbo Shuei (the 19th).

sen.j: 1899年(明治32年)、日下義雄に従い1ヶ月渡韓。
sen.e: In 1899 he accompanied Yoshio KUSAKA in his trip to Korea for one month.
In 1899 he accompanied Yoshio KUSAKA in his trip to Korea for one month.
In 1899 he accompanied Yoshio KUSAKA in his trip to Korea for one month.

sen.j: 京城の高手で中枢員議官の白南奎という者と対戦、四子（朝鮮ルールの二子）にまで打ち込んで「神童来」と言われる。
sen.e: In Takate in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule) he played so well with four stones down to start the game (in the Korean rule two stones) against Haku Nankei, a Chusuin official that he was called a "prodigy".

In Takate in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule) he played so well with four stones down to start the game (in the Korean rule two stones) against Haku Nankei, a Chusuin official, that he was called a 'prodigy.'
sen.cmt: 「白南奎」の読みは確認出来ておりません。スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。クォーツ、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In Takate in Keijo (old name of Seoul City in the period of Japan's rule) he played so well with four stones down to start the game (in the Korean rule two stones) against Haku Nankei, a Chusuin official, that he was called a 'prodigy.'

sen.j: 1900年には秀栄との十番碁を開始。
sen.e: He began Juban Go (a series of 10 games either with the same opponent or with a team of opponents) against Shuei in 1900.
He began Juban Go (a series of 10 games either with the same opponent or with a team of opponents) against Shuei in 1900.
He began Juban Go (a series of 10 games either with the same opponent or with a team of opponents) against Shuei in 1900.

sen.j: 1905年に方円社を退社して、この年に秀栄の組織した「日本囲棋会」に入り、秀栄門下となるとともに五段に昇段。
sen.e: In 1905 he, leaving Hoen-sha, entered "Japan Igo Kai" organized by Shuei in the same year, was promoted to 5 dan, and became Shuei's disciple at the same time.
In 1905, he left Hoen-sha, entered 'Japan Igo Kai' organized by Shuei in the same year, then promoted to 5 dan, while becoming Shuei's disciple at the same time.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。 クォーツを修正しました。he, leaving→he left,5→five,was→then,and became→while becoming と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1905, he left Hoen-sha, entered 'Japan Igo Kai' organized by Shuei in the same year, then promoted to 5 dan, while becoming Shuei's disciple at the same time.

sen.j: 1907年(明治40年)1月六段。
sen.e: In January, 1907 he became a 6 dan holder.
In January, 1907, he became a six dan holder.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。6→six と修正しました。
sen.e: In January, 1907, he became a six dan holder.

sen.j: この披露会にて伊藤公より、「東西分局勢 黒白闘雌雄 坐看輸贏迹 賢愚老此中」の詩章を贈られる。
sen.e: In this reception he was given a shi-sho (context of a poem or a book with musical components) of "東西分局勢 黒白闘雌雄 坐看輸贏迹 賢愚老此中".
sen.cmt: *詩は意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず
sen.e: In this reception he was given a shi-sho (context of a poem or a book with musical components) from Ito: '東西分局勢 黒白闘雌雄 坐看輸贏迹 賢愚老此中.'
sen.cmt: 「伊藤公より」を補いました。「伊藤公」の”公”は”雁金からして敬いを込めたもの”とし、ここでは"Ito"のみにしてあります。詩は意味解釈が困難なため訳出できずコロンを使用し、クォーツ、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In this reception he was given a shi-sho (context of a poem or a book with musical components) from Ito: '東西分局勢 黒白闘雌雄 坐看輸贏迹 賢愚老此中.'

sen.j: 本因坊継承争い
sen.e: Strife on the Succession of Honinbo
Strife on the Succession of Honinbo
Strife on the Succession of Honinbo

sen.j: この頃、秀栄の後継候補は雁金と5歳年長の田村保寿で、実力は田村が上であったが、秀栄は田村の性格を嫌っており、跡目を決めることはなかった。
sen.e: In those days possible candidates of Shuei were KARIGANE and Yasuhisa TAMURA, who was five years older and a better player than KARIGANE; however, Shuei did not did not decide his successor because he did not like TAMURA's character.

In those days, the possible candidates of Shuei were Karigane and Yasuhisa TAMURA, who was five years older and a better player than Karigane; however, Shuei did not decide his successor because he did not like Tamura's character.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。KARIGANE→Karigane,TAMURA→Tamura と修正しました。did not を削除しました。
sen.e: In those days, the possible candidates of Shuei were Karigane and Yasuhisa TAMURA, who was five years older and a better player than Karigane; however, Shuei did not decide his successor because he did not like Tamura's character.

sen.j: また田村が七段昇段記念の碁(1905年)で、相手の雁金五段に持碁にするように申し入れた件を棋譜から見破られたことも、田村が信用を失う一因とされる。
sen.e: dan) of finishing their match in a jigo (drawn match) in a go match in commemoration of his promotion to 7 dan was revealed from the kifu (record of a game of go, shogi, chess, etc.).

Also, it is said to have been a factor, which Tamura lost Shuei's trust when he asked Karigane, five dan, finishing their match in a jigo (drawn match) in the commemoration of his promotion to seven dan (in 1905) was revealed from the kifu (record of a game of go, shogi, chess, etc.).
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて全体を修正しました。
sen.e: Also, it is said to have been a factor, which Tamura lost Shuei's trust when he asked Karigane, five dan, finishing their match in a jigo (drawn match) in the commemoration of his promotion to seven dan (in 1905) was revealed from the kifu (record of a game of go, shogi, chess, etc.).

sen.j: 1907年2月に秀栄が、雁金を本因坊にと遺言を残して没すると、本因坊の名跡を巡り六段雁金と七段田村をそれぞれ推す派が対立し、暫定で秀栄の弟で本因坊秀和の三男である本因坊秀元が20世本因坊となる。
sen.e: In February, 1907 Shuei passed away, leaving a will that KARIGANE should be Honinbo, which brought a conflict on the succession of the professional name Honinbo between supporters of KARIGANE Rokudan (6 dan) and those of TAMURA Nanadan (7 dan), therefore, Honinbo Shugen, Shuei's younger brother and Shuwa Honinbo's third son, became a temporal Honinbo the 12th.

In February, 1907, Shuei passed away leaving a will that Karigane to be Honinbo, which brought a conflict on the succession of the professional name Honinbo between the supporters of Karigane Rokudan (6 dan) and the those of Tamura Nanadan (7 dan), therefore, Honinbo Shugen, Shuei's younger brother and Shuwa Honinbo's third son, became the provisional Honinbo the 21st.
sen.cmt: カンマを補い、削除しました。KARIGANE→Karigane,should→to,the を補いました。TAMURA→Tamura,a temporal→the provisional, 12th→21st と修正しました。
sen.e: In February, 1907, Shuei passed away leaving a will that Karigane to be Honinbo, which brought a conflict on the succession of the professional name Honinbo between the supporters of Karigane Rokudan (6 dan) and the those of Tamura Nanadan (7 dan), therefore, Honinbo Shugen, Shuei's younger brother and Shuwa Honinbo's third son, became the provisional Honinbo the 21st.

sen.j: 雁金は秀栄未亡人派による敲玉会の首班となるが、翌年に秀元から田村に本因坊位が譲られ、田村は21世本因坊秀哉となり、敲玉会は雁金の脱退により解散する。
sen.e: KARIGANE became a top leader of Kogyoku-kai of the sect of Shuei's widow, however, the Honinbo-i (rank of Honinbo) was given over to TAMURA from Shugen, and as a result, TAMURA became Honinbo Shusai the 21st and the Kyogyoku-kai was dismissed due to KARIGANE' s withdrawal.

Karigane became the leader of Kogyoku-kai, the group of Shuei's widow, however, the Honinbo-i (rank of Honinbo) was given over to Tamura from Shugen in the following year, and as a result, Tamura became Honinbo Shusai the 21st and the Kyogyoku-kai was dissolved due to Karigane' s withdrawal.
sen.cmt: KARIGANE→Karigane,TAMURA→Tamura,dismissed→dissolved と修正しました。文前半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。「翌年に」を補いました。
sen.e: Karigane became the leader of Kogyoku-kai, the group of Shuei's widow, however, the Honinbo-i (rank of Honinbo) was given over to Tamura from Shugen in the following year, and as a result, Tamura became Honinbo Shusai the 21st and the Kyogyoku-kai was dissolved due to Karigane' s withdrawal.

sen.j: この年に八段昇段もした秀哉の襲名披露会には雁金も出席し、広瀬平治郎五段との席上碁を務めるが、その後は対局から遠ざかる。
sen.e: In the same year KARIGANE attended a party for Shusai, who also became a 8 dan holder, announcing the succession of the name Honiobo, and played a game against Heijiro HIROSE at the party, but after that he receded from go games.

In the same year Karigane attended the party announcing the succession of the name Honiobo by Shusai, who also became a eight dan holder, and played a game against Heijiro HIROSE, five dan holder at the party, but after that he kept away Go games.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正し、適宜修正しました。「五段」を補いました。KARIGANE→Karigane,8→eight,receded from go→kept away Go と修正しました。
sen.e: In the same year Karigane attended the party announcing the succession of the name Honiobo by Shusai, who also became a eight dan holder, and played a game against Heijiro HIROSE, five dan holder at the party, but after that he kept away Go games.

sen.j: 棋正社時代まで
sen.e: Until Kiseisha Years
Until Kiseisha Years
Until Kiseisha Years

sen.j: 1915年に、1907年に発足した関西囲碁研究会（関西囲棋会）会員になる。
sen.e: In 1915 he became a member of Kansai Igo Kenkyu-kai (Kansai Iki-kai) inaugurated in 1907.
In 1915, he became a member of Kansai Igo Kenkyu-kai (Kansai Iki-kai) inaugurated in 1907.
In 1915, he became a member of Kansai Igo Kenkyu-kai (Kansai Iki-kai) inaugurated in 1907.

sen.j: 1917年には、雁金を井上家跡目とすることが一門で決議されるが、1920年に恵下田栄芳が正式に16世井上因碩を襲名する。
sen.e: In 1917 the Inoue Sept decided to have KARIGANE as their heir, but in 1920 Eiho EGATA officially succeeded to the name INOUE the 16th.
In 1917, the Inoue school (stable) decided to have Karigane as the successor, but in 1920 Eiho EGATA officially succeeded to the name of Inseki INOUE the 16th.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。Sept→school (stable) （ここでの一門はschool, stable としての意味合いで修正しました）,KARIGANE→ Karigane,their heir→the successor,name INOUE→name of the Inseki INOUE と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1917, the Inoue school (stable) decided to have Karigane as the successor, but in 1920 Eiho EGATA officially succeeded to the name of Inseki INOUE the 16th.

sen.j: 1919年に時事新報主催の林徳蔵三段戦を行い(先二、二子番、雁金中押勝)、13年振りの対局となる。
sen.e: In 1919 he played a match against Tokuzo HAYASHI Sandan (3 dan) sponsored by the Jiji Shinpo (senni, nishiban and KARIGANE's nakaoshi victory) for the first time in thirteen years.
In 1919, he played a match against Tokuzo HAYASHI Sandan (3 dan), sponsored by the Jiji Shinpo (senni, nishiban and KARIGANE's nakaoshi victory) for the first time in 13 years.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。thirteen→13 と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1919, he played a match against Tokuzo HAYASHI Sandan (3 dan), sponsored by the Jiji Shinpo (senni, nishiban and KARIGANE's nakaoshi victory) for the first time in 13 years.

sen.j: 同年、関源吉、吉沢道三、小林鍵太郎らと、大正囲棋会を設立。
sen.e: In the same year he, together with Genkichi SEKI, Dosan YOSHIZAWA, Kentaro KOBAYASHI and others, founded Taisho Iki-kai.
In the same year, he founded Taisho Iki-kai together with Genkichi SEKI, Dosan YOSHIZAWA, Kentaro KOBAYASHI and others.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。スペースを修正しました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: In the same year, he founded Taisho Iki-kai together with Genkichi SEKI, Dosan YOSHIZAWA, Kentaro KOBAYASHI and others.

sen.j: その後政財界有力者の間で雁金に打たせようという相談がまとまり、1920年3月、細川護立の催しで、1914年に名人 (囲碁)就位していた秀哉と対戦、13回打掛けで翌年1月30日終局、雁金(先)6目勝。
sen.e: Subsequently among people in the political and business world an idea of having KARIGANE play games was arranged, and on March, 1920, under the auspices of Moritatsu HOSOKAWA he played a match with 13 uchikake (intermissions) against Shuya, who became a 8 dan holder in 1914, and the match was finished on January 30, the next year, resulting in KARIGANE's win (sente or initiative move) by six moku (points).

Subsequently among people in the political and business world, an idea of having Karigane to play games was arranged, and on March, 1920, as the auspices of Moritatsu HOSOKAWA, he played a match with 13 uchikake (intermissions) against Shuya, who had been ranked as a meijin (Go) in 1914, and the match was finished on January 30, the following year, resulting in Karigane's win (sente or initiative move) by 6 moku (points).
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。スペースを修正しました。KARIGANE→Karigane,under→as,next→following,six→6 と修正しました。to を補いました。「名人（囲碁）就位していた」という部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Subsequently among people in the political and business world, an idea of having Karigane to play games was arranged, and on March, 1920, as the auspices of Moritatsu HOSOKAWA, he played a match with 13 uchikake (intermissions) against Shuya, who had been ranked as a meijin (Go) in 1914, and the match was finished on January 30, the following year, resulting in Karigane's win (sente or initiative move) by 6 moku (points).

sen.j: 同年4月にも久保松勝喜代五段昇段披露会席上で秀哉と対戦し、33手で打掛け。
sen.e: In April of the same year at Katsukiyo KUBOMATSU's reception party announcing his promotion to 5 dan, he played against Shusai with the match ending in an uchikake at 33rd move.
In April of the same year at Katsukiyo KUBOMATSU's reception party announcing his promotion to 5 dan, he played against Shusai with the match ending in an uchikake at 33rd move.
In April of the same year at Katsukiyo KUBOMATSU's reception party announcing his promotion to 5 dan, he played against Shusai with the match ending in an uchikake at 33rd move.

sen.j: 同年5月時事新報主催で秀哉戦、打掛け19回で12月28日終局、秀哉(白)中押勝。
sen.e: In May in the same year he played a game sponsored by Jiji Shipo against Shusai, which had 19 uchikake and ended on December 28 with a win of Shusai (white) by nakaoshi.
In May in the same year he played a game sponsored by Jiji Shipo against Shusai, which had 19 uchikake and ended on December 28 with a win of Shusai (white) by nakaoshi.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: In May in the same year he played a game sponsored by Jiji Shipo against Shusai, which had 19 uchikake and ended on December 28 with a win of Shusai (white) by nakaoshi.

sen.j: 方円社理事となるが1922年に脱退し、高部道平、鈴木為次郎、瀬越憲作の4棋士で裨聖会設立。
sen.e: He became a director of Hoen-sha, but retired from it in 1922 to found "Hisei-kai" with other three kishi including Dohei TAKABE, Tamejiro SUZUKI and Kensaku SEGOE.
He became a director of Hoen-sha, but retired from it in 1922 to found "Hisei-kai" with other three kishi including Dohei TAKABE, Tamejiro SUZUKI and Kensaku SEGOE.
He became a director of Hoen-sha, but retired from it in 1922 to found "Hisei-kai" with other three kishi including Dohei TAKABE, Tamejiro SUZUKI and Kensaku SEGOE.

sen.j: 裨聖会は、総互先コミ出し、持ち時間制などを初めて導入した。
sen.e: The Kisei-kai first introduced sogo-sen-komi- dashi and a time limit rule.
The Kisei-kai introduced sogo-sen-komi-dashi and a time limit rule as the first time.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。first→as the first time とし、移動しました。
sen.e: The Kisei-kai introduced sogo-sen-komi-dashi and a time limit rule as the first time.

sen.j: この中では雁金が最も成績優秀、次いで瀬越であった。
sen.e: Among them KARIGANE was the best player followed by SEGOE.
Karigane was the best player among them, followed by Segoe.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。カンマを補いました。KARIGANE→Karigane,SEGOE→Segoe と修正しました。
sen.e: Karigane was the best player among them, followed by Segoe.

sen.j: 高部道平らの活動による1924年の碁界大合同で日本棋院に参加するが、同年、雁金、鈴木為次郎、高部道平、加藤信、小野田千代太郎が、報知新聞と日本棋院規約に反して個人契約して除名。
sen.e: With a great coalition of the Go world (1924) promoted by Dohei TAKABE, KARIGANE joined Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Asoociation), however, KARIGANE, Tamejiro SUZUKI, Dohei TAKABE, Shin KATO and Chiyotaro ONODA KATO were expelled bacause of their individual contracts against regulations between Hochi Shimbun and Nihon Ki-in.

With a great coalition of the Go world in 1924 promoted by Dohei TAKABE, Karigane joined Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Association); however, in the same year, Karigane, Tamejiro SUZUKI, Dohei TAKABE, Shin KATO and Chiyotaro ONODA were expelled because of their individual contracts against regulations between Hochi Shimbun and Nihon Ki-in.
sen.cmt: (1924)→in 1924,KARIGANE→Karigane,Asoociation→Association,bacause→because と修正しました。パンクチュエーションを修正しました。「同年」を補いました。KATOを削除しました。
sen.e: With a great coalition of the Go world in 1924 promoted by Dohei TAKABE, Karigane joined Nihon Ki-in (the Japanese Go Association); however, in the same year, Karigane, Tamejiro SUZUKI, Dohei TAKABE, Shin KATO and Chiyotaro ONODA were expelled because of their individual contracts against regulations between Hochi Shimbun and Nihon Ki-in.

sen.j: この5棋士にて棋正社を設立。
sen.e: These five kishi founded Kisei-sha.
These five kishi founded Kisei-sha.
These five kishi founded Kisei-sha.

sen.j: 翌年七段に昇段。
sen.e: He was promoted to 7 dan the next year.
He was promoted to seven dan the following year.
He was promoted to seven dan the following year.

sen.j: 鈴木、加藤は1926年に棋正社を離脱。
sen.e: SUZUKI and KATO left Kisei-sha in 1926.
Suzuki and Kato left Kisei-sha in 1926.
Suzuki and Kato left Kisei-sha in 1926.

sen.j: 1926年に読売新聞を通じ、棋正社と日本棋院の間で院社対抗戦（正式名称は日本棋院対棋正社敗退手合）を開始、大正大争碁とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: In 1926 through the Yomiuri Shimbun In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Kisei-sha) matches (officially called Nihon Kiin Tai Kisei-sha Haitai Teai) were started, which were also called Taisho-daisogo.
In 1926 through the Yomiuri Shimbun, In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Kisei-sha) matches (officially called Nihon Kiin Tai Kisei-sha Haitai Teai) were started, which were also called Taisho-daisogo.
In 1926 through the Yomiuri Shimbun, In (Nihon Ki-in) vs Sha (Kisei-sha) matches (officially called Nihon Kiin Tai Kisei-sha Haitai Teai) were started, which were also called Taisho-daisogo.

sen.j: 初戦に秀哉ー雁金(先)戦が行われ、254手までで雁金の時間切れ負けとなる。
sen.e: The first match was between Shusai and KARIGANE (sente), which ended in KARIGANE's loss due to time out.
The first match was between Shusai and Karigane (sente), which ended in Karigane's loss with 254 moves, due to time out.
sen.cmt: KARIGANE→Karigane と修正しました。「254手までで」を補いました。
sen.e: The first match was between Shusai and Karigane (sente), which ended in Karigane's loss with 254 moves, due to time out.

sen.j: 以後の勝ち抜き戦で、棋正社は常勝将軍と呼ばれた野沢竹朝も加えるが、1929年終了時には棋正社の14勝26敗2持碁となった（雁金は4勝9敗）。
sen.e: In the following tournament Kiseisha plused Chikucho NOZAWA called an ever-victorious shogun, and in this tournament which ended in 1929, Kiseisha got 14 wins, 26 losses and 2 draws (KARIGANE got 4 wins and 9 losses).

In the following tournament Kiseisha added Chikucho NOZAWA called an ever-victorious shogun, and in this tournament which ended in 1929, Kiseisha had 14 wins, 26 losses and 2 draws (KARIGANE had 4 wins and 9 losses).
sen.cmt: plused→added, got→had と修正しました。
sen.e: In the following tournament Kiseisha added Chikucho NOZAWA called an ever-victorious shogun, and in this tournament which ended in 1929, Kiseisha had 14 wins, 26 losses and 2 draws (KARIGANE had 4 wins and 9 losses).

sen.j: この院社対抗戦を掲載した読売新聞は社を挙げて宣伝し、観戦記には村松梢風ら文士を配し、また秀哉ー雁金戦が序盤から大乱戦となったことも手伝い、発行部数を3倍に伸ばした。
sen.e: The Yomiuri Shimbun that reported this In vs Sha tournament tripled its number of issues by advertizing it with the whole company, placing persons of letters including Shofu MURAMATSU and others in witness's accounts of the games, and partly because a Shusai vs KARIGANE match became quite a confused one from the beginning.

The Yomiuri Shimbun that reported this In vs Sha tournament tripled its number of issues by advertizing it with the whole company, placing the men of letters including Shofu MURAMATSU and others in witness's accounts of the games, and partly because the Shusai vs Karigane match became a scuffle from the beginning.
sen.cmt: persons→men,a→the,KARIGANE→Karigane,quite a confused one→a scuffle と修正しました。
sen.e: The Yomiuri Shimbun that reported this In vs Sha tournament tripled its number of issues by advertizing it with the whole company, placing the men of letters including Shofu MURAMATSU and others in witness's accounts of the games, and partly because the Shusai vs Karigane match became a scuffle from the beginning.

sen.j: 瓊韻社以後
sen.e: From Keiinsha Years on
From Keiinsha Years on
From Keiinsha Years on
In 1933 he became a 8 dan holder.
In 1933 he became a eight dan holder.
In 1933 he became a eight dan holder.

sen.j: 1941年、高部との対立により、一門を率いて棋正社を離脱して瓊韻社を設立。
sen.e: Because of the conflict against TAKABE, he left Kisei-sha with his sept members to found Keiin-sha.
Because of the conflict against TAKABE, he left Kisei-sha with his school to find Keiin-sha in 1941.
sen.cmt: 「1941年」を補いました。TAKABE→Takabe,sept members→school,found→find と修正しました。
sen.e: Because of the conflict against TAKABE, he left Kisei-sha with his school to find Keiin-sha in 1941.

sen.j: 同年、62歳で、日本棋院の呉清源七段と打込み十番碁を開始。
sen.e: In the same year at age 62 he began uchikomu juban go matches against Seigen GO Nanadan (7 dan) in Nihon Ki-in.
In the same year, at the age of 62, he began uchikomu juban Go matches against Seigen GO Nanadan (seven dan) of Nihon Ki-in.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。at age→at the age of,go→Go,7→seven,in→of と修正しました。
sen.e: In the same year, at the age of 62, he began uchikomu juban Go matches against Seigen GO Nanadan (seven dan) of Nihon Ki-in.

sen.j: この時の囲碁の手合割について、日本棋院では雁金の段位を認めるかが問題となったが、雁金の意向で互先となる。
sen.e: As to teaiwari (handicaps), Nihon Ki-in discussed a matter of admitting KARIGANE's dan-i (dan grading), however KARIGANE chose tagai-sen.
As to teaiwari (handicaps), Nihon Ki-in discussed a matter of admitting KARIGANE's dan-i (dan grading), however KARIGANE chose tagai-sen.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: As to teaiwari (handicaps), Nihon Ki-in discussed a matter of admitting KARIGANE's dan-i (dan grading), however KARIGANE chose tagai-sen.

sen.j: 戦績は翌年第5局まで雁金の1勝4敗となり、打ち切りとなった。
sen.e: He had a record of one win and four losses up to the fifth game in the next year, and the rest of the games were canceled.
He had a record of one win and four losses up to the fifth game in the following year, and the rest of the games were canceled.
He had a record of one win and four losses up to the fifth game in the following year, and the rest of the games were canceled.

sen.j: また、続いて瓊韻社の渡辺昇吉六段の藤沢朋斎六段との十番碁も行われるが、藤沢3連勝で打ち切りとなる。
sen.e: Next, Juban Go Matches between Shokichi WATANABE Rokudan (6 dan) in Keiin-sha and Hosai FUJISAWA were conducted, ending in cancellation due to FUJISAWA's three successive wins.
Also, the juban Go matches between Shokichi WATANABE Rokudan (six dan) of Keiin-sha and Hosai FUJISAWA (six dan) were conducted; ending in the cancellation due to Fujisawa's three successive wins.
sen.cmt: Next→Also,Juban Go Matches→juban Go matches,6→six,FUJISAWA→Fujisawa と修正しました。the, カンマ、(six dan) を補いました。
sen.e: Also, the juban Go matches between Shokichi WATANABE Rokudan (six dan) of Keiin-sha and Hosai FUJISAWA (six dan) were conducted; ending in the cancellation due to Fujisawa's three successive wins.

sen.j: その後、日本棋院棋士との交流手合もあり、また棋院への復帰運動もあったが、瓊韻社にとどまり続けた。
sen.e: After this there were exchange matches with kishi in Nihon Ki-in and also a return movement to Nihon Ki-in, however, he remained in Keiin-sha.
After that, there were exchange matches with kishi of Nihon Ki-in, and also a return movement to Nihon Ki-in, however, he remained in Keiin-sha.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。After this→After that,in→of と修正しました。
sen.e: After that, there were exchange matches with kishi of Nihon Ki-in, and also a return movement to Nihon Ki-in, however, he remained in Keiin-sha.

sen.j: 1944年、準名人戦（読売新聞主催）に出場、呉清源に白番ジゴとする。
sen.e: He participated in Quasi-expert Tournament (sponsored by the Yomiuri Shimbun) and played against Seigen GO, resulting in shiroban-jigo.
In 1944, he participated in the Quasi-expert Tournament (sponsored by the Yomiuri Shimbun), and played against Seigen GO, resulting in shiroban-jigo.
sen.cmt: 「1944年」を補いました。カンマ、the を補いました。
sen.e: In 1944, he participated in the Quasi-expert Tournament (sponsored by the Yomiuri Shimbun), and played against Seigen GO, resulting in shiroban-jigo.

sen.j: 1952年、全本因坊八段戦に出場、橋本宇太郎に白番半目負け。
sen.e: In 1952 he participated in Zen Honinbo 8 Dan Tournament only to be defeated by Utaro HASHIMOTO by shiroban han-moku.
In 1952, he participated in the Zen Honinbo Eight Dan Tournament, defeated by Utaro HASHIMOTO by shiroban han-moku.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。8→Eight と修正しました。only to be を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1952, he participated in the Zen Honinbo Eight Dan Tournament, defeated by Utaro HASHIMOTO by shiroban han-moku.

sen.j: 1953年、三長老戦で優勝。
sen.e: He won the championship in the San Choro (patriarch) Sen (matches).
He became the winner of the San Choro (patriarch) Sen (matches) in 1953.
sen.cmt: won the championship in→became the winner of と修正しました。「1953年」を補いました。
sen.e: He became the winner of the San Choro (patriarch) Sen (matches) in 1953.

sen.j: 1959年1月、九段に推挙。
sen.e: In 1959 he was recommended for a 9 dan holder.
In January, 1959, he was recommended for a nine dan holder.
sen.cmt: 9→nine と修正しました。「1月」、カンマを補いました。
sen.e: In January, 1959, he was recommended for a nine dan holder.

sen.j: 同年2月21日没。
sen.e: He passed away on February 21 of the same year.
He passed away on February 21 of the same year.
He passed away on February 21 of the same year.

sen.j: 日本棋院より名誉九段を追贈される。
sen.e: He was awarded posthumous Meiyo Kudan (honorable 9 dan) by Nihon Ki-in.
He was awarded posthumous Meiyo Kudan (honorable nine dan) by Nihon Ki-in.
He was awarded posthumous Meiyo Kudan (honorable nine dan) by Nihon Ki-in.

sen.j: 墓所は顕本寺。
sen.e: His grave is located in Kenpon-ji Temple.
His grave is located in Kenpon-ji Temple.
His grave is located in Kenpon-ji Temple.

sen.j: 秀栄は、手の見える碁と評していた。
sen.e: Shuei spoke of his Go as one with visible moves.
Shuei commented on his Go as one with visible moves.
sen.cmt: spoke of→commented on と修正しました。なお、ここでの「手の見える」とは”手が読める”との意味合ではないかとも思ったのですがそのままにしております。
sen.e: Shuei commented on his Go as one with visible moves.

sen.j: また性格温厚、人格高潔であったと世に言われている。
sen.e: He is also said to have had a mild and noble character.
He is also said to have had a mild and noble character.
He is also said to have had a mild and noble character.

sen.j: 門下に、渡辺昇吉九段、富田忠夫八段ら。
sen.e: His disciples included Shokichi WATANABE Kudan, Tadao TOMITA Hachidan (8 dan) and others.
His disciples included Shokichi WATANABE Kudan (nine dan), Tadao TOMITA Hachidan (eight dan) and others.
sen.cmt: (nine dan) を補いました。8→eight と修正しました。
sen.e: His disciples included Shokichi WATANABE Kudan (nine dan), Tadao TOMITA Hachidan (eight dan) and others.

sen.j: 鄒海石、笠井浩二も少年時代に指導を受けた。
sen.e: SU Kaiseki and Koji KASAI also received guidance in their boyhood.
Kaiseki SU and Koji KASAI also received guidance in their boyhood.
sen.cmt: SU Kaiseki→Kaisei SU と修正しました。
sen.e: Kaiseki SU and Koji KASAI also received guidance in their boyhood.

sen.j: 富田門下には王銘エン九段、鄭銘瑝九段らがおり、王の本因坊位獲得により、孫弟子の代で本因坊位に就いたとも言える。
sen.e: TOMITA's disciples were O Meien Kudan, Tei Meiko Kudan and others, and it might be said that O's acquirement of Honinbo-i put KARIGANE in Honinbo-i in his second disciple generation.

Tomita's disciples were O Meien Kudan (nine dan), Tei Meiko Kudan (nine dan) and others, and it might be said that O's acquirement of Honinbo-i put Karigane in Honinbo-i in his second disciple generation.
sen.cmt: TOMITA→Tomita,KARIGANE→Karigane と修正しました。(nine dan)を補いました。
sen.e: Tomita's disciples were O Meien Kudan (nine dan), Tei Meiko Kudan (nine dan) and others, and it might be said that O's acquirement of Honinbo-i put Karigane in Honinbo-i in his second disciple generation.
